column1: Year,Date,Event,Significance

c. 500,,[Tikal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tikal ) becomes the first great [Maya](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maya_civilization ) city,Significant cultural exchange between the Maya of Tikal and the citizens of [Teotihuacan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Teotihuacan ).

c. 500,,[Battle of Mons Badonicus](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Mons_Badonicus ).,The [West Saxon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kingdom_of_the_West_Saxons ) advance is halted by [Britons](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Britons_(historic) ) in England. Chiefly known today for the supposed involvement of [King Arthur](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/King_Arthur ) but because of the limited number of sources, there is no certainty about the date, location, or details of the fighting.

507,Spring,The [Franks](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Franks ) under [Clovis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clovis_I ) defeat the [Visigoths](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Visigoths ) in the [Battle of Vouillé](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Vouill%C3%A9 ).,The Visigoths retreated into Spain.

c. 524,,[Boethius](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boethius ) writes his _[Consolation of Philosophy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Consolation_of_Philosophy )_,It has been described as the single most important and influential work in the West on Medieval and early Renaissance Christianity.

525,,[Dionysius Exiguus](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dionysius_Exiguus ) publishes the [Dionysius Exiguus' Easter table](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dionysius_Exiguus%27_Easter_table ).,This initiated the [Anno Domini](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anno_Domini ) era, used for the [Gregorian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gregorian_calendar ) and [Julian calendars](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Julian_calendar ).

527,August 1,[Justinian I](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Justinian_I ) becomes [Eastern Roman Emperor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eastern_Roman_Emperor ).,Justinian is best remembered for his Code of Civil Law (529), and expansion of imperial territory retaking Rome from the Ostrogoths.

529–534,,[Justinian I](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Justinian_I ) publishes the [Code of Civil Law](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Corpus_Juris_Civilis ).,This compiled centuries of legal writings and imperial pronouncements into three parts of one body of law.

529,,[Benedict of Nursia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Benedict_of_Nursia ) founds monastery at [Monte Cassino](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monte_Cassino ).,The first of twelve monasteries founded by Saint Benedict, beginning the [Order of Saint Benedict](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Order_of_Saint_Benedict ).
532,January 1,[Nika riots](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nika_riots ) in Constantinople.,Nearly half the city being burned or destroyed and tens of thousands of people killed.

533,December 15,Byzantines, under [Belisarius](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Belisarius ), retake North Africa from the [Vandals](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vandals ).,Vandal kingdom ends and the Reconquest of North Africa is completed.

535–554,,[Gothic War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gothic_War_(535%E2%80%93554) ) in Italy as a part of [Justinian's](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Justinian_I ) Reconquest.,Byzantines retook Italy but crippled the [Byzantine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Byzantine_Empire ) economy and left Italy unable to cope against the oncoming [Lombards](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lombards ).

563,,Saint [Columba](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Columba ) founds mission in [Iona](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iona ).,Constructed an [abbey](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Abbey ) which helped convert the [Picts](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Picts ) to Christianity until it was destroyed and raided by the [Vikings](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vikings ) in 794.

568,,The [Kingdom of the Lombards](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kingdom_of_the_Lombards ) is founded in Italy.,Survived in Italy until the invasion of the [Franks](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Franks ) in 774 under [Charlemagne](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charlemagne ).

c. 570,,[Muhammad](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Muhammad ) is born.,Professed receiving revelations from [God](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/God ), which were recorded in the [Quran](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quran ), the basis of Islamic theology, in which he is regarded as the last of the sent prophets.

577,,The West Saxons continue their advance at the [Battle of Deorham](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Deorham ).,Led to the permanent separation of [Cornwall](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cornwall ), England from [Wales](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wales ).
581–618,March 4 – May 23,[Sui dynasty](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sui_dynasty ) in China.,China unified once again during this period for the first time in almost 400 years.

590,September 3,[Gregory the Great](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gregory_the_Great ) becomes [Pope](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pope ).,The missionary work reached new levels during his pontificate, revolutionized the way of worship for the Catholic Church ([Gregorian chant](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gregorian_chant )), liturgy, etc., and was soon canonized after his death.
597,,[Augustine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Augustine_of_Canterbury ) arrives in [Kent](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kent ).,Christianization of England (Anglo-Saxons) begins.

598–668,,Massive Chinese ([Sui](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Goguryeo%E2%80%93Sui_War ) and [Tang](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Goguryeo%E2%80%93Tang_War )) invasions against [Korean](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Korea ) [Goguryeo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Goguryeo ).,Contributed to the fall of the [Sui dynasty](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sui_dynasty ), and Goguryeo fell under the forces of the Tang and [Silla](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Silla ).

c. 600,,Deliberate fires set for unknown reasons destroy major buildings in [Teotihuacan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Teotihuacan ).,Destroys the Teotihuacan civilization and empire. [Tikal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tikal ) is now the largest [city-state](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/City-state ) in [Mesoamerica](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mesoamerica ).
